intro: Clarkia tenella, commonly known as the slender clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Clarkia tenella is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
